While mass incarceration is a national problem, it must be dismantled at the state level. And Indiana has big role to play. While the national state imprisonment rate dropped eight percent between 2000 and 2016, Indiana’s imprisonment rate grew 18 percent.

The ACLU Smart Justice Campaign is dedicated to cutting the nation’s incarcerated population in half and combatting racial disparities in the criminal justice system.

Here’s what you need to know about the path to smart justice in Indiana.

We worked with the Urban Institute and other partners to provide a unique snapshot of Indiana’s incarcerated population, including an analysis of the drivers of mass incarceration, and why Hoosiers are imprisoned for so long. Most importantly, the Blueprint offers solutions tailored for Indiana — solutions that will have a real, calculable impact on people’s lives.

In order to end mass incarceration, every state — and every one of us — must join the movement to cut the prison population. That starts with comprehensive, cutting-edge analysis. Check out Indiana’s Blueprint to see how, together, we can end mass incarceration.

Thanks for sticking with us,

ACLU of Indiana
